channel.title: Reconnaissance on D0CUM3NTN4T10N
channel.description: Recent content in Reconnaissance on D0CUM3NTN4T10N

item.title: Identifying My Target
item.description: Identifing Our Target linkNeed to identify What’s within the SCOPE and What’s not. Example: https://bugcrowd.com/tesla

item.title: Discovering Email Addresses
item.description: Discovering Email Addresses linkHunter.io linkhunter.io also can identify the pattern of the email address. In this case it is {f}{last}@tesla.com which means {fist name initial}{last name}@tesla.com If I had an account created, I can see alot more information about the email addresses of the target. Phonebook.cz link Clearbit linkThis is also a fantastic Chrome Extension that allows me to discover email addresses with some other cool details that other tools did not find.

item.title: Hunting Credentials
item.description: Dehashed linkThis is a website which costs money but definitely worth it. With this I can browse through all the breached databases and find potential credentials in many ways.

item.title: Subdomain Discovery
item.description: Sublist3r link sublist3r.py -d tesla.com -o sub.tesla.com.log crt.sh linkWith this website, I can find subdomains of a domain by Certificate Fingerprinting. httprobe linkI can check if all the subdomains that I found ealier are up or not with this tool. cat /opt/Sublist3r/sub.tesla.com.log | httprobe

item.title: Web Technologies
item.description: BuiltWith linkWith this website, I can find what technologies does the target websited utilizes. Wappalyzer linkSimilar to BuiltWith.com, with this website I can find what technologies does the target websited utilizes. Wappalyzer also has browser extensions that comes in handy when it comes to time management.
